glycerin.explanation: Common humectant/moisturizer; generally well tolerated in topical products.

aqua.explanation: Water; used as a solvent/base ingredient.

water.explanation: Water; used as a solvent/base ingredient.

cocamidopropyl betaine.explanation: Can irritate sensitive skin in some people; patch-test if prone to reactions.

paraben.explanation: Paraben preservatives can raise sensitivity concerns for some users; prefer lower exposure if worried.

methylparaben.explanation: Paraben preservative; some users prefer to avoid due to sensitivity concerns.

propylparaben.explanation: Paraben preservative; some users prefer to avoid due to sensitivity concerns.

fragrance.explanation: Fragrance mixes may trigger irritation or allergies in sensitive users.

perfume.explanation: Fragrance mixes may trigger irritation or allergies in sensitive users.

formaldehyde.explanation: Known hazardous substance; generally restricted/regulated in consumer products.

formalin.explanation: Formaldehyde solution; associated with significant health risks; generally restricted/regulated.

hydroquinone.explanation: Skin-lightening active with safety concerns; regulated/restricted in many places.

mercury.explanation: Toxic heavy metal; prohibited/restricted in cosmetics and personal care.

lead.explanation: Toxic heavy metal; restricted in cosmetics; avoid exposure.

triclosan.explanation: Antibacterial agent with safety/environment concerns; restricted in several jurisdictions.

sodium lauryl sulfate.explanation: Cleansing surfactant that may be drying/irritating for sensitive skin.

sls.explanation: Often refers to sodium lauryl sulfate; can be drying/irritating for some users.

sodium laureth sulfate.explanation: Cleansing surfactant; generally milder than SLS but may still irritate sensitive users.

phenoxyethanol.explanation: Preservative; generally safe at typical concentrations but may irritate very sensitive skin.
